alert.note: Alert for Calcasieu; Cameron (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued December 18 at 1:32PM CST until December 18 at 2:30PM CST by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: The National Weather Service in Lake Charles has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Cameron Parish in southwestern Louisiana... Southwestern Calcasieu Parish in southwestern Louisiana... East central Jefferson County in southeastern Texas... Southeastern Orange County in southeastern Texas... * Until 230 PM CST. * At 131 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Edgerly to near Port Arthur, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Port Arthur, Orange, Groves, Port Neches, Bridge City, Cameron, West Orange, Vinton, Grand Lake, Sabine National Wildlife, Sabine Pass, Johnsons Bayou, Toomey, Hackberry, Holly Beach, Pinehurst, Carlyss and Constance Beach. This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 in Texas between mile markers 880 and 878. Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 9. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
